intro: Blackiella conduplicata var. phyllocarpa, commonly known as the red-flowered blackiella, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround its small, greenish flowers. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
